sentence.Network_en: I can affirm that he is tenacious and pertinacious as are few.
sentence.Network_cn: 我可以肯定,像他那样不屈不挠、百折不回的人是十分罕见的.

sentence.Network_en: Questions buzzed in his head like pertinacious bees.
sentence.Network_cn: 一连串问题在他脑子里盘旋着,就象纠缠不休的蜜蜂.

sentence.Network_en: He had been driven into a corner by the pertinacious ingenuity of Miss French.
sentence.Network_cn: 弗伦奇小姐的再接再厉的巧妙手腕逼得他一点办法也没有.

pertinacious bigotry 固执的偏见 perverselyadv. 丧心病狂地 Petrified wood may be ligneous in appearance, but it is stonelike in composition. a baneful.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin pertinax, pertinac- 'holding fast' + -ous

entry.tran: 坚定不移的；坚决的；义无反顾的
entry.def: Someone who is pertinacious continues trying to do something difficult rather than giving up quickly.

sentences.sentence: "the most vocal and pertinacious of all the critics"
"a mind not gifted to discover truth but tenacious to hold it"- T.S.Eliot

auth_sentence.content: Bruno was declared an "impenitent, pertinacious, and obstinate heretic," and he was condemned to die.
auth_sentence.res_content: Bruno was declared an "impenitent, pertinacious, and obstinate heretic," and he was condemned to die.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Bruno was declared an "impenitent, pertinacious, and obstinate heretic," and he was condemned to die.

auth_sentence.content: David is pertinacious, and when his meager bankroll is stolen, he vows to walk the entire distance.
auth_sentence.res_content: David is pertinacious, and when his meager bankroll is stolen, he vows to walk the entire distance.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: David is pertinacious, and when his meager bankroll is stolen, he vows to walk the entire distance.
